newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia May CPI up 1.62 pct vs 1.55 pct yr-ago.
newsitem.headline: Colombia May CPI up 1.62 pct vs 1.55 pct yr-ago.

text.p: Colombia's consumer price index rose 1.62 percent in May compared with 1.55 percent in the same month last year, the National Statistics Department said Monday.
The rise in the index is running at 9.94 percent for the first five months of this year, compared to 12.75 percent in the same period last year, the department said.

The cumulative rise in the consumer price index for the last 12 months is now running at 18.6 percent, 1.18 percentage points lower than the cumulative 12-month figure to May 1996, the statistics department said.
Inflation for all of 1996 was 21.63 percent, and the central bank has set a target of 18 percent inflation for this year.
The rise in the consumer price index was driven by a 2 percent advance in health costs, a 1.97 percent increase in food prices and a 1.94 percent gain in housing costs.
Education rose the least at 0.31 percent, while transport costs grew just 0.35 percent and clothing prices were up 1.01 percent.
The biggest rise in the consumer price index was seen in the northwest city of Monteria, capital of Cordoba province, up 2.3 percent compared to 0.7 percent last May.
The lowest rise was in the northeast city of Cucuta, capital of Norte de Santander province, up 0.93 percent compared to 1.38 percent a year ago.

Bogota posted a 1.93 percent gain in consumer prices compared to 1.88 percent in May 1996, while Colombia's second largest city Cali saw retail prices rise 1.02 percent against 0.23 percent a year ago.
